sense.name: length of timber, building material
sense.examples: He nailed boards over the windows to prepare for the hurricane. I'll need a 2-by-4 treated board to repair the deck. There were boards lain across the muddy path to walk on.

sense.name: food or fare set upon a table
sense.examples: A sumptuous board was spread out for us in the dining room. The inn provided a hearty board to its guests. Room and board for one year will cost $10,000.

sense.name: panel or device of electronic controls
sense.examples: The mechanic replaced an entire board of the cockpit control panel. That's a machine for making printed circuit boards.

sense.name: committee with supervisory powers
sense.examples: This issue should go before the board. The medical board did not pass her. John was nervous to go in front of the board of examiners. I was on the board of directors for two years.

sense.name: a display for public information
sense.examples: The teacher wrote two problems on the board. John went to the board to draw his diagram. Are these stocks traded on the Big Board? I couldn't read the score on the board sitting where I was.

sense.name: a surface related to game play
sense.examples: White still has both knights on the board. Each bridge player drew their cards from the board. If your dice roll off the board you lose your turn. They set up ten boards for the Monopoly championship.
